H0.text: The soil is the original source of the energy that animals obtain from the food they eat.

H1.text: The water cycle is the original source of the energy that animals get from the food they eat.

H2.text: The Sun is the original source of the energy that animals get from the food they eat.

H3.text: Fertilizers are the original source of the energy that animals get from the food they eat.

A4.text: Photosynthesis converts light energy—typically from sunlight—into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: The general equation for photosynthesis as first proposed by Cornelis van Niel is: CO2 + 2H2A + photons → [CH2O] + 2A + H2O.
